verses.roman:
bhaktera prema-vikāra dekhi' kṛṣṇera camatkāra!
kṛṣṇa yāra nā pāya anta, kebā chāra āra?

synonyms: bhaktera—of a devotee; prema-vikāra—transformations of ecstatic emotion; dekhi'-seeing; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; camatkāra—wonder; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; yāra—of which; nā pāya—cannot get; anta—the limit; kebā—who; chāra—insignificant; āra—others.
translation: Even Lord Kṛṣṇa is struck with wonder at seeing the transformations of ecstasy in His devotees. If Kṛṣṇa Himself cannot estimate the limits of such emotions, how could others?
